intro: Mystacidium dentiens, commonly known as the toothed mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that primarily grows on the branches of coniferous trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its berries are dark red or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Mystacidium dentiens plays a role in forest ecosystems by providing food for various bird species and contributing to the ecological diversity of its host trees.
